question: What is the main premise of the Gate Control Theory of pain?
answers: Pain signals are only processed in the brain
Pain signals can be blocked at the spinal cord level by non-painful input
Massage removes pain signals from nerves
Pain only results from injury to bones

question: Where in the nervous system does the 'gate' in Gate Control Theory exist?
answers: Dorsal horn of the spinal cord

question: Which type of nerve fibers are responsible for closing the pain gate?
What role does massage play in the Gate Control Theory?
answers: It stimulates fast-conducting A-beta fibers to inhibit pain

question: Which of the following sensations can help 'close the gate' on pain?
Why is Gate Control Theory important in massage therapy?
answers: It explains how massage decreases lymph flow
It shows how certain strokes may worsen inflammation
It provides a neurological basis for massage's pain-relieving effects
It proves massage can realign spinal vertebrae

question: How does deep pressure affect the gate control mechanism?
answers: It closes the gate faster than light pressure
It may stimulate pain fibers and open the gate
It has no effect on the gate

question: Which technique best aligns with Gate Control Theory to reduce pain?
What happens when the pain gate is 'open'?
answers: Pain signals reach the brain more easily
The spinal cord stops processing input

question: Which best describes the relationship between sensory input and pain modulation in Gate Control Theory?
answers: Sensory input has no effect on pain
Stimulating sensory receptors can inhibit pain perception
Sensory input always increases pain signals
Pain only occurs with sensory loss
